data.title: Lovable Alternatives for 2026
data.description: A practical guide to Lovable alternatives, with a comparison table and decision framework, for prototypes that need to grow up fast.

data.title: Agent Skills vs. Rules vs. Commands
data.description: Agent skills, rules, and commands offer different, strategic context for AI agents. Here’s when to use each and how to optimize them for production.

data.title: OpenCode vs Claude Code
data.description: Is Anthropic's polished CLI better than the open-source alternative? We compare features, the OAuth drama, and why visual context is the missing piece.

data.title: Cursor’s Design Mode (Visual Editing) Explained
data.description: Is Cursor’s design mode a Figma killer? Here’s how it works, where it falls short for non-developers and on source mapping, and how to let designers edit code.

data.title: The AI software engineer in 2026
data.description: AI tools are everywhere, but trust is falling. Learn how engineers become orchestrators in 2026, choosing which agents to scaffold, ship, and maintain.

data.title: The Best MCP Servers for Developers in 2026
data.description: Discover the best MCP servers for devs in 2026 to code, ship, and automate safely with powerful, standardized tooling. Turn AI agents into real assistants.

data.title: Cursor Alternatives in 2026
data.description: Cursor redefined AI coding, but it’s no longer alone. Explore the best Cursor alternatives in 2026 for agents, speed, pricing, control, and workflows.

data.description: AI prototyping helps teams align faster with real data, mergeable code, and workflows that turn early ideas into production-ready progress.

data.description: Discover the best VS Code extensions for 2026 to boost productivity, code quality, and collaboration with faster, smarter tools for every developer.

data.title: The best agentic IDEs heading into 2026
data.description: Agentic IDEs are evolving fast. Explore the leading tools reshaping code editors into teammates, from Cloud sandboxes to editor-embedded agents.

data.title: Create a full-stack app with AI
data.description: Create and deploy a full-stack voting board app with AI. Fusion for UI, Supabase for auth and data, Netlify for hosting.

data.description: Discover five powerful ways to use the Supabase MCP server with Fusion to create dynamic, AI-powered web apps. No coding required. Fast setup, easy workflow.

data.title: Why Is AI Design Bad?
data.description: Why most AI design tools disappoint, and how designers can get better, brand-consistent results by working visually, in code, and with smart component reuse.

data.description: A designer-friendly guide to git branching, merging, and pull requests, all explained with relatable Figma examples and visuals. Experiment with confidence.

data.title: Designers Can Ship without Engineering Handoffs
data.description: Designers can ship UI changes without engineering handoffs. With Fusion, visually edit your live site, use real tokens and components, and make PR‑ready diffs.

data.title: Production-grade AI Prototyping
data.description: Production-grade AI prototyping with Fusion: connect your repo, use real components, iterate in multiplayer, and ship PR-ready code. No throwaway demos.

data.title: You Need Evals to Ship AI Features
data.description: AI features are unpredictable and traditional tests fall short. Evals, automated checks for AI behavior, help you prevent regressions and measure success.

data.title: Test-Driven Development with AI
data.description: Learn how AI transforms test-driven development (TDD) from a time-consuming chore into your secret weapon for building robust and bug-free applications.

data.title: Code Review in the AI Age
data.description: AI hasn't replaced developers; it's promoted them to architects. Learn how to review AI-generated code and use tools that create review-friendly diffs.

data.title: Design to Code with the Figma MCP Server
data.description: Turn Figma designs into code using the official MCP server. Skip screenshot guesswork and let AI access structured design data directly through Figma's API.

data.title: The MCP Client for Design Handoffs
data.description: MCP clients let AI agents connect to your tools, but most are either chat-only or IDE-only. Fusion bridges design and dev workflows.

data.title: Mock Up a Website in Five Prompts
data.description: Learn how to create a website mockup in minutes using AI-assisted tools. This guide walks through building a bakery site from concept to working prototype.

data.title: AI for Grown-ups
data.description: AI tools often generate quick but messy code. Let's examine how AI can integrate with professional workflows to be productive without sacrificing quality.

data.title: What is the Agent2Agent (A2A) Protocol?
data.description: The Agent2Agent (A2A) Protocol enables AI agents to collaborate across networks, streamlining discovery, authentication, and data exchange.

data.title: Fine-tune an LLM: Why, when, and how
data.description: Fine-tuning LLMs can save tokens, guarantee output formats, & bake in edge-case fixes. Learn when to fine-tune & how to do it effectively for your AI projects.

data.title: How to Build Your Own MCP Server
data.description: Learn to build a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server for AI assistants. This tutorial covers creating tools, resources, and prompts for a CSS tutor example.

data.title: Designing Agentic AI Systems: A Web Dev’s Guide
data.description: Web developers' skills in system design and API integration are key for building effective AI agent systems. Learn about core concepts and common patterns.

data.title: What is the Model Context Protocol (MCP)?
data.description: MCP aims to standardize AI tool integration, potentially simplifying development and enabling more capable AI assistants. Current adoption is limited.

data.title: What is an AI Agent?
data.description: AI agents use models, loops, memory, and tools to automate complex tasks. Learn how they work, their evolution, and their practical uses and limitations.
